  • Element
com.citytechinc.cq.component.annotations.widgets

Annotation Type Html5SmartFile


  • @Retention(value=CLASS)
@Target(value={FIELD,METHOD})
public @interface Html5SmartFile
    Represents a Widget of type CQ.html5.form.SmartFile in Classic UI Represents a Widget of type granite/ui/components/foundation/form/fileupload in Touch UI

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String fileNameParameter
      Name of the form field used for posting the file name.
      String fileReferenceParameter
      Name of the form field used for posting the file reference.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean allowFileNameEditing
      Used for Classic UI only True if the name of an uploaded file is editable
      boolean allowFileReference
      Used for Classic UI only Flag if referencing a file is allowed
      boolean allowUpload
      Used for Classic UI only Flag if uploading a file is allowed
      boolean autoStart
      Used for Touch UI Only If true, upload starts automatically once the file is selected
      String ddAccept
      Used for Classic UI only MIME type definition of files that are allowed for referencing using drag & drop
      String[] ddGroups
      Used for Classic UI only Groups involved in drag & drop
      String dropZone
      Used for Touch UI Only Drop zone selector to upload files from file system directly (if browser allows it)
      String icon
      Used for Touch UI Only The icon of the button
      String mimeTypes
      Used for Classic UI only MIME types allowed for uploading (each separated by a semicolon; wildcard * is allowed; for example: "*.*" or "*.jpg;*.gif;*.png" (defaults to "*.*".) Also support MIME type syntax; for example (image/jpg or image/*)
      String mimeTypesDescription
      Used for Classic UI only A String that describes the allowed MIME types
      boolean multiple
      Used for Touch UI Only Indicates that multiple files may be uploaded
      String name
      Used for Classic UI only The field's HTML name attribute
      int sizeLimit
      Maximum size of a file to be uploaded in Megabytes
      String text
      Used for Touch UI Only The text of the button
      String title
      Used for Touch UI Only The title associated with the upload button
      String[] touchUIMimeTypes
      Used for Touch UI only The list of mime types allowed for upload.
      String uploadUrl
      Used for Touch UI Only URL where to upload the file, you can use ${suffix.path}
      String uploadUrlBuilder
      Used for Touch UI Only The AEM documentation indicates that this should be an upload URL builder
      boolean useHtml5
      Used for Touch UI Only Prefer HTML5 to upload files (if browser allows it)

    • Element Detail

      • fileNameParameter

        public abstract String fileNameParameter
        Name of the form field used for posting the file name. Be aware that you will have to specify a suitable value here, as there is no sensible default value available. Suitable values are dependant on their serverside counterpart and must be "./fileName" for CQ foundation's image and download components; use "./image/fileName" for the textimage component.
        Returns:
        String

      • fileReferenceParameter

        public abstract String fileReferenceParameter
        Name of the form field used for posting the file reference. Be aware that you will have to specify a suitable value here, as there is no sensible default value available. Suitable values are dependant on their serverside counterpart and must be "./fileReference" for CQ foundation's image and download components; use "./image/fileReference" for the textimage component.
        Returns:
        String

      • name

        public abstract String name
        Used for Classic UI only The field's HTML name attribute
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""

      • allowFileNameEditing

        public abstract boolean allowFileNameEditing
        Used for Classic UI only True if the name of an uploaded file is editable
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        true

      • allowFileReference

        public abstract boolean allowFileReference
        Used for Classic UI only Flag if referencing a file is allowed
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        true

      • allowUpload

        public abstract boolean allowUpload
        Used for Classic UI only Flag if uploading a file is allowed
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        true

      • ddAccept

        public abstract String ddAccept
        Used for Classic UI only MIME type definition of files that are allowed for referencing using drag & drop
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        "*"

      • ddGroups

        public abstract String[] ddGroups
        Used for Classic UI only Groups involved in drag & drop
        Returns:
        String[]
        Default:
        {}

      • mimeTypes

        public abstract String mimeTypes
        Used for Classic UI only MIME types allowed for uploading (each separated by a semicolon; wildcard * is allowed; for example: "*.*" or "*.jpg;*.gif;*.png" (defaults to "*.*".) Also support MIME type syntax; for example (image/jpg or image/*)
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        "*.*"

      • touchUIMimeTypes

        public abstract String[] touchUIMimeTypes
        Used for Touch UI only The list of mime types allowed for upload. This must be defined uniquely for Touch UI as the ExtJS allows different extension and wild card semantics than the Touch UI variant.
        Returns:
        String[]
        Default:
        {}

      • mimeTypesDescription

        public abstract String mimeTypesDescription
        Used for Classic UI only A String that describes the allowed MIME types
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        "All files"

      • sizeLimit

        public abstract int sizeLimit
        Maximum size of a file to be uploaded in Megabytes
        Returns:
        int
        Default:
        0

      • multiple

        public abstract boolean multiple
        Used for Touch UI Only Indicates that multiple files may be uploaded
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        false

      • uploadUrl

        public abstract String uploadUrl
        Used for Touch UI Only URL where to upload the file, you can use ${suffix.path}
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        "${suffix.path}"

      • uploadUrlBuilder

        public abstract String uploadUrlBuilder
        Used for Touch UI Only The AEM documentation indicates that this should be an upload URL builder
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""

      • autoStart

        public abstract boolean autoStart
        Used for Touch UI Only If true, upload starts automatically once the file is selected
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        false

      • useHtml5

        public abstract boolean useHtml5
        Used for Touch UI Only Prefer HTML5 to upload files (if browser allows it)
        Returns:
        boolean
        Default:
        true

      • dropZone

        public abstract String dropZone
        Used for Touch UI Only Drop zone selector to upload files from file system directly (if browser allows it)
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""

      • title

        public abstract String title
        Used for Touch UI Only The title associated with the upload button
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""

      • text

        public abstract String text
        Used for Touch UI Only The text of the button
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""

      • icon

        public abstract String icon
        Used for Touch UI Only The icon of the button
        Returns:
        String
        Default:
        ""
